item.title: What Shibu Inu’s (SHIB) On-Chain Security Engine Test Reveals
item.dc:creator: Tadas Klimasevskis
item.description:
The on-chain security intelligence engine provided by CertiK indicates why crypto investors trust Shiba Inu.

Continue reading What Shibu Inu’s (SHIB) On-Chain Security Engine Test Reveals at DailyCoin.com.
item.content:encoded:
The on-chain data analytics tool CertiK recently published a technical report on Shiba Inu‚Äôs (SHIB) health, social mentions, and overall security rank. As $SHIB and #ShibaInu are trending again on Twitter this Tuesday afternoon, Shiba Inu recorded a day in the green with 3.9% gains for the past 24 hours.

SHIB also had a strong rebound week, with a 13% increase in the last seven days. At press time, the mega-popular memecoin trades at $0.00000927, according to CoinGecko.

#shibainu is trending.. again?!

Don't miss the @Shibtoken's CertiK page with all the highlights

Coming in at #2 on the Security Leaderboard, #SHIB has collected a number of badges.https://t.co/ICSISKiYoX pic.twitter.com/zsVmTtlPZ4

— CertiK Security Leaderboard (@CertiKCommunity) January 9, 2023

Key Strong Points for SHIB

The crypto audit company disclosed that SHIB ranks second in the security charts. This was calculated using CertiK’s Skynet Trust Score formula, which stands at ‚ÄòExcellent,‚Äô as the two-year-old canine coin scored a nearly-perfect 93/100. Paired with market price performance, social sentiment, and relative security, the score highlights the advantages of the ERC-20 token, which are as follows:

  • SHIB is relatively decentralized
  • The memecoin also has a large market cap
  • The developers are offered bug bounties

On top of that, Shiba Inu‚Äôs decentralized exchange ShibaSwap auditioned separately a year ago. During the test, 34 bugs were found in the code, with 33 fully fixed. The last bug is only partially fixed, according to the audit report, but CertiK acknowledged that none of the found bugs were critical.

#SHIBARMY CertiK is a great place to check how secure a project is https://t.co/z8ilLbnNN5

— $SHIB BPP (@ShibBPP) January 9, 2023

What is the SHIB Army Woofing About?

Shiba Inu scores highest in the Market and Community Index, with 95/100. Interestingly, the most used word in relation to SHIB on social media is ‚ÄúCommunity.‚Äù The crypto enthusiasts known collectively as the SHIB Army hence contribute a lot towards the positive social sentiment for the canine memecurrency.

Other popular keywords include ‚ÄúWoof,‚Äù ‚ÄúShibarium,‚Äù ‚ÄúSoon,‚Äù ‚ÄúNFT,‚Äù ‚ÄúBone,‚Äù and ‚ÄúMetaverse.‚Äù Interestingly, the Shiba Army likes to talk about competing memecoins, as both ‚ÄúDOGE‚Äù and ‚ÄúBabyDoge‚Äù are also trending in community discussions on Crypto Twitter. Ultimately, it seems that the superstar SHIB gained trust among crypto enthusiasts, as 77% of social mentions have a positive connotation.

For sure . #WoofWoof

— Regular Billionaire SHIB (@RegularShib) January 10, 2023

On the Flipside

  • The audit on Shiba Inu’s decentralized exchange was carried out nearly two years ago.
  • Furthermore, the popular memecoin scores lowest on the Price Sentiment Index, which stands at the neutral level of 59.

Why You Should Care

Started as an ERC-20 token on Ethereum’s (ETH) blockchain, Shiba Inu now further transitions into a self-sufficient ecosystem.

Follow the latest moves of Shiba Inu, the star player of memecoins:

Shiba Inu (SHIB) Strikes Merch Deal as SHIB Burn Rate Lights Up 1395%

Shiba Inu (SHIB) Adds Shibarium News Section, Bone ShibaSwap (BONE) Grows 30%

item.title: Coinbase (COIN) Cuts Another 20% of Workforce amid Persistent Crypto Winter
item.dc:creator: Rue Abernai
item.description:
CEO Brian Armstrong said that the layoffs are part of the company‚Äôs decision to reduce operating costs by around 25%.

Continue reading Coinbase (COIN) Cuts Another 20% of Workforce amid Persistent Crypto Winter at DailyCoin.com.
item.content:encoded:
• Coinbase fired about 950 people ‚Äì or around 20% of its workforce ‚Äì on Tuesday.
  • CEO Brian Armstrong said that the fresh round of job cuts is part of the company‚Äôs decision to reduce its operating costs by around 25%.
  • Armstrong said that Coinbase is in a good position to weather the crypto storm despite the layoffs.
  • Armstrong said he believes the FTX fiasco and other recent events have benefited his exchange.
  • This is the third round of layoffs Coinbase has done in the last seven months.

Coinbase (COIN) has made a fresh round of layoffs. The crypto exchange announced on Tuesday that it had fired about 950 people ‚Äì or around 20% of its workforce.

Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong said that the layoffs are part of the company‚Äôs decision to reduce operating costs by around 25%.

Despite the layoffs, Armstrong said that Coinbase is in a good spot both financially and emotionally. He said that the failure of FTX has benefited the company.

‚ÄúCoinbase is well capitalized, and crypto isn't going anywhere. In fact, I believe recent events will ultimately end up benefiting Coinbase greatly (a large competitor failing, emerging regulatory clarity, etc.), and they validate our long term strategy. But it will take time for these changes to come to fruition and we need to make sure we have the appropriate operational efficiency to weather downturns in the crypto market, and capture opportunities that may emerge,‚Äù Armstrong said.

Armstrong also said that Coinbase has shut down a few projects with ‚Äúa lower probability of success.‚Äù

The new round of layoffs at Coinbase is the third over the last seven months. The company fired over 1,100 people in June and more than 60 in November last year.

On the Flipside

  • The fresh job cuts have potentially made Coinbase a lighter company and saved much-needed funds.
  • Many crypto-related companies have made job cuts in the last few months to better prepare for the crypto winter.

Why You Should Care

Coinbase is the second-largest crypto exchange in the world. The new round of layoffs shows that the current environment crypto companies find themselves in is harsh and requires appropriate preparation.

You Might Also Like:

Coinbase CLO ‚ÄòGrateful‚Äô for $100M Settlement with NY over Compliance Failures

item.title: Gemini’s Winklevoss Accuses DCG CEO Silbert of Fraud, Demands His ‘Immediate’ Removal
item.dc:creator: Rue Abernai
item.description:
Winklevoss said that Silbert and DCG committed accounting fraud by lying that DCG had absorbed Genesis‚Äô 3AC losses.

Continue reading Gemini’s Winklevoss Accuses DCG CEO Silbert of Fraud, Demands His ‘Immediate’ Removal at DailyCoin.com.
item.content:encoded:
• Gemini co-founder Cameron Winklevoss has published another open letter on Twitter, this time addressing the DCG board.
  • He asked the board to ‚Äúimmediately‚Äù remove DCG founder and CEO Barry Silbert from the company because he committed accounting fraud.
  • Winklevoss said that Silbert and DCG falsely claimed that DCG had absorbed Genesis‚Äô losses linked to the implosion of Three Arrows Capital (3AC).
  • Winklevoss claimed that DCG‚Äôs 10-year $1.2 billion promissory note with Genesis was labeled as ‚ÄúCurrent Assets,‚Äù though it couldn‚Äôt be converted into cash.
  • Winklevoss also provided details on why Genesis was able to lend $2.36 billion to 3AC.

Crypto exchange Gemini co-founder Cameron Winklevoss has released another open letter, this time to the board of Digital Currency Group (DCG).

In the letter, published on Twitter on Tuesday morning, Winklevoss said that Genesis, DCG, and its founder and CEO Barry Silbert defrauded Gemini and its 340,000 Earn program users by making false statements about the solvency and financial health of Genesis.¬†

He asked the DCG board to ‚Äúimmediately‚Äù remove Silbert from the company.

Winklevoss also claimed that Silbert and other key DCG personnel lied about DCG having absorbed Genesis‚Äô massive losses linked to the crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital (3AC) and its bankruptcy last year.

In particular, Winklevoss said that after Genesis lost $1.2 billion ‚Äì or approximately 15% of its loan book‚Äôs assets ‚Äì after 3AC blew up following the implosion of Terra Luna, it decided not to go the debt restructuring path but instead ‚Äúembarked on a carefully crafted campaign of lies‚Äù to convince its customers that DCG had indeed absorbed Genesis‚Äô losses.

‚ÄúDCG had not ensured that Genesis had the capital to operate. In fact, DCG hadn‚Äôt given Genesis so much as a penny of actual funding to make up for the 3AC losses. Instead, DCG entered into a 10-year promissory note with Genesis at an interest rate of 1% ‚Äì due in 2023. This note was a complete gimmick that did nothing to improve Genesis‚Äô immediate liquidity position or make its balance sheet solvent,‚Äù he explained.

Accounting Fraud Accusations

Winklevoss claimed that ‚Äúmultiple Genesis and DCG personnel began doubling down with more lies.‚Äù He explained that Gemini had received a document from Genesis‚Äô then-Head of Trading and Lending Matthew Ballensweig showing the 10-year promissory note under ‚ÄúCurrent Assets.‚Äù

That, according to Winklevoss, was accounting fraud since the promissory note couldn‚Äôt be converted into cash or other assets could can be converted into cash within one year. On top of that, Winklevoss said that the actual value of the unsecured long-dated promissory note was around $300 million, not $1.2 billion.

‚ÄúThese misrepresentations (repeated in many documents sent to Gemini and other lenders over the following months) were a sleight of hand designed to make it appear as if Genesis was solvent and able to meet its obligations to lenders, without DCG actually committing to the financial support necessary to make this true. DCG wanted to have its cake and eat it too. And Barry and DCG might have gotten away with it, if not for the FTX collapse,‚Äù he said.

Grayscale‚Äôs Involvement

Winklevoss also offered his explanation of how Genesis managed to lend $2.36 billion to 3AC.¬†

According to him, Genesis was inclined to lend to 3AC because the hedge fund used the borrowed money for the ‚Äúkamikaze‚Äù Grayscale GBTC trade that ‚Äúballooned‚Äù the AUM of GBTC and generated a lot of fees for Grayscale, which DCG wholly owns.

This worked as long as the value of GBTC shares was more than the underlying Bitcoin. When the value of the shares started to go down in 2021, Genesis started to lose this trade. On top of that, Winklevoss claimed that the lender participated only in the losing side of the trade because it ‚Äúalways ceded the GBTC share premium to 3AC.‚Äù

However, Winklevoss said that Genesis continued to lend to 3AC even after the premium inverted. He said Genesis did so because the Bitcoin that makes up the GBTC fund can‚Äôt be redeemed.

‚ÄúThings only begin to make sense when you realized that the Bitcoin this swap was stuffing into the Grayscale‚Äôs Trust like a Thanksgiving turkey is stuck there forever. It can never be redeemed (or at least until Grayscale, in its sole discretion, decides to implement a redemption program allowing GBTC shares to be converted back into Bitcoin. As a result, Barry was comfortable with Genesis loading up more and more on this toxic trade because it was a gambit to feed the Grayscale‚Äôs Trust ‚Äì Barry‚Äôs financial Hotel California that would print money for the DCG universe in perpetuity. The end would justify the means,‚Äù Winklevoss explained.

Winklevoss also said that Genesis hid the risk swaps by ‚Äúmischaracterizing the first and last legs of these swaps transactions as collateralized loans on its balance sheet.‚Äù He also called it accounting fraud.

Investigation by U.S. Authorities

DCG‚Äôs problems became even more complicated when Bloomberg reported that the U.S. Department of Justice and the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) were investigating the crypto conglomerate.

According to Bloomberg, Silbert‚Äôs DCG has received requests for documents and interviews related to internal transfers at Genesis. A DCG spokesperson said that DCG is unaware of any active investigations into the company.

Genesis‚Äô issues came to light in late November last year when the lender halted loan redemptions and new loan issuances. Hours later, Gemini, which used Genesis as its lender platform, also halted withdrawals for its 340,000 Earn program users who now have over $900 million stuck on Gemini.

Since then, neither DCG nor Genesis has moved to solve this problem. Gemini‚Äôs Winklevoss had issued an ultimatum to Silbert to publicly commit to solving this issue by January 8, but the DCG boss failed to do so.

On the Flipside

  • It‚Äôs unclear whether the DCG board will respond to Winklevoss‚Äô demands.
  • Winklevoss has yet to sue Silbert and DCG.
  • It‚Äôs unclear how a new CEO would help Genesis to come up with more than a billion dollars. Winklevoss himself said earlier that Silbert de facto controls all DCG conglomerates.

Why You Should Care

DCG and Genesis are among the largest crypto companies in the industry. Going under might mean more pain to crypto users and investors in the short term.

You Might Also Like:

Barry Silbert‚Äôs DCG Faces SEC and DOJ Investigation Over Internal Transfers

item.title: NFT Marketplace MOOAR Invites Creators to Participate in Launchpad Season 2
item.dc:creator: Insha Zia
item.description:
After taking feedback from project creators and users, MOOAR is ready to start Season 2.

Continue reading NFT Marketplace MOOAR Invites Creators to Participate in Launchpad Season 2 at DailyCoin.com.
item.content:encoded:
Find Satoshi Lab‚Äôs subscription-based NFT marketplace, MOOAR, has officially announced the opening of MOOAR Launchpad Season 2. After successfully launching Season 1 last month, MOOAR raised over 5.3 million GMT locked into tickets for 13 exciting genesis projects.¬†

The NFT marketplace has encouraged all creators to make submissions. MOOAR has shared that it is actively looking for upcoming projects that have the potential to benefit the ecosystem.

MOOAR Launchpad Season 2⃣

We are pleased to announce that #MOOAR Season 2 submissions are now OPEN

Deadline: 16th Feb 2023

We have outlined a set of guidelines this season to better support creators and create a more seamless process [1/4]https://t.co/XRhlsoo21H

— MOOAR | Season #2 (@mooarofficial) January 9, 2023

More Than Just Profile Pictures

MOOAR started as a Profile Picture (PFP), creator-centric NFT marketplace based on Ethereum and Solana. The NFT marketplace has shared that it believes digital identity is the future which is why it focuses on PFP NFT projects.¬†

However, in the latest blog post, MOOAR revealed that it is more inclusive this time and expects creators to submit innovative projects with utility that could benefit the ecosystem.¬†

The NFT marketplace reiterated that while PFPs are an integral part of MOOAR‚Äôs roadmap for the future of Web3, it doesn‚Äôt mean that other avenues of value creation should be filtered out.¬†

Here are essential details about Launchpad Season 2:

  • Users can make submissions until 16th February.¬†
  • Once the submission period closes, MOOAR‚Äôs team will review all submissions.¬†
  • MOOAR will approve the top ten most promising projects and officially enter them into the Season 2 launchpad contest.¬†
  • The NFT marketplace has also made a few launchpad adjustments, including changes to ticket prices, voting limit, creator toolkit, and more.¬†
  • The upper limit for ticket prices has increased to 200 GMT.¬†
  • The voting limit has increased to 30,000 GMT per account.¬†
  • Season 2 will host submissions from both Solana and Ethereum.¬†
  • Users can vote for multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Creators can issue NFTs in batches in the newest season.¬†
  • Finally, users can mint up to 20 Ethereum-based NFTs in one go.¬†

More details can be found on MOOAR‚Äôs official blog,¬†

Educating Creators

MOOAR also shared that it would launch a creator-focused workshop, MOOAR Creator Bootcamp, in tandem with the new Launchpad season. The one-week workshop will consist of five two-hour sessions.¬†

The session will welcome new creators to the Web3 space and ensure a smoother onboarding process.¬†

Attendees can select from the following topics:

  • Topic 1: Creating your first NFT
  • Topic 2: Fundamentals of Design (Art, AR, VR)
  • Topic 3: Understanding NFT Metadata
  • Topic 4: Web3 Marketing
  • Topic 5: Community Building ‚Äî Ambassadors & KOLs
  • Topic 6: HypeSaints (MOOAR Season 1 Winner) ‚Äî Insight into their journey
  • Topic 7: Introduction to NFT Utility + MOOAR Incubator Program

MOOAR will host sessions on the top five requested topics. The workshop aims to give participants a deeper insight into the NFT creation process. At the end of the workshop, attendees must present their NFT collection for review by the MOOAR team. MOOAR will give the top three projects a grant worth 17,000 GMT.¬†

On the Flipside

  • A MOOAR subscription fee costs $29.90 per month.
  • Reportedly, creators submitted 140 collections to MOOAR Launchpad Season 1.

Why You Should Care

Find Satoshi Lab is committed to improving its platform for its users. The marketplace is keen on contributing to the Web3 space by introducing exciting vetted projects to its users and the world.¬†

 

You may also like:

Stepn‚Äôs Parent Company Inaugurates Dedicated Subscription-Based NFT Marketplace

item.title: Dogecoin (DOGE) Grows 7% as Elon Musk Rolls Out New Twitter Features
item.dc:creator: Tadas Klimasevskis
item.description:
Elon Musk is ready to unleash the power of DOGE upon Twitter with a flurry of exciting upgrades.

Continue reading Dogecoin (DOGE) Grows 7% as Elon Musk Rolls Out New Twitter Features at DailyCoin.com.
item.content:encoded:
The top dog memecoin Dogecoin (DOGE) is again at the forefront of Twitter 2.0 as Elon Musk gets ready to launch new features on the social media platform. Previously, many Twitter 2.0 plans were paused due to a lack of staff, as Elon ‚ÄòThe Dogefather‚Äô Musk laid off more than 50% of the old guard.

However, on Sunday,¬†Chief Twit Elon Musk announced several upcoming features. At the same time, his beloved canine token recorded a 7% weekly bull run, strengthening the rebound rally with increased social mentions, thanks to the always optimistic DOGE Army. At press time, DOGE is changing hands at $0.076995, according to CoinGecko.

#DogecoinToTheMoon #DOGE -1 #doge father pic.twitter.com/CVSDEBKDil

— Khalƒêoge79 (@dogesuppporteam) January 10, 2023

Tinderesque Features for Twitter?

Interestingly, Elon Musk shared that the first feature to go live on Twitter is a left/right swipe between recommendations and followed tweets. This type of user interface resembles Tinder, the most popular dating app. In addition, users will also be able to bookmark their favorite tweets instead of just liking them.

Furthermore, tweets soon won‚Äôt be limited to just 280 characters. The upcoming ‚Äòlong form tweets‚Äô is said to have a 4000-character limit, which would significantly reshape the micro-blogging platform. Finally, the Twitter Crypto Wallet is still in development, while Mr. Musk also promised an all-in-one app, which is set to transition Twitter into a multi-functional social hub.

Very Twitter Tinder-ish of us

— Christine Barnum (@christinebarnum) January 8, 2023

DOGE Plays Key Role in Twitter 2.0

Naturally, the leading memecurrency is likely to play a significant part in the upgrades, as bull runs for DOGE usually coincide with the development of Twitter 2.0. According to the DOGE Army, there are five factors in the new plan that can heavily contribute towards the adoption of the canine coin.

These include Twitter Crypto Wallet, Twitter Merch Store, Tipping Jar, Twitter Blue & Twitter Boost. Besides, some crypto enthusiasts speculate that Dogecoin can become the centerpiece of the upcoming app and the Tesla Phone. As a default payment method, DOGE would become a social media powerhouse similar to Telegram‚Äôs Toncoin (TON).

Hey @elonmusk unleash the power of #doge upon twitter:

-Payments
-Tip Jar
-Twitter Merch Store
-Boost Posts
-Twitter Blue

All these options can utilize $DOGE pic.twitter.com/eiYECUd1Jk

— Doge Dillionaire (@DogeDillionaire) January 7, 2023

On the Flipside

  • Cardano (ADA) flipped Dogecoin (DOGE) for the 8th spot in the crypto charts by global market capitalization.

Why You Should Care

Some DOGE-related features, like the Tipping Jar, have already launched. Hence, the developers of Dogecoin expect to see a rally once other relevant features go live on Twitter.

Find out what’s happening in the mercurial world of memecoins:

Shiba Inu (SHIB) Strikes Merch Deal as SHIB Burn Rate Lights Up 1395%

Bonk (BONK) Slips 18% Despite Solana (SOL) Topping Shiba Inu (SHIB)

item.title: BAYC Creators Yuga Labs Ordered to Testify Under Oath in Ryder Ripps Case
item.dc:creator: Tadas Klimasevskis
item.description:
More monkey business for Bored Apes, as the founders are obliged to answer some inconvenient questions under oath.

Continue reading BAYC Creators Yuga Labs Ordered to Testify Under Oath in Ryder Ripps Case at DailyCoin.com.
item.content:encoded:
• In early 2022, Ryder Ripps spread Nazi allegations against BAYC.
  • Ryder Ripps went on to release his own version of Bored Apes NFT.
  • Yuga Labs slapped the artist with a lawsuit for trademark infringement.

The fierce dispute between renowned digital artist Ryder Ripps and the owners of the Bored Apes Yacht Club NFT collection just took an unexpected turn. The Federal Judge ruled Monday that both co-founders of Yuga Labs, the company behind BAYC NFT, must attend court depositions.

Controversial statements regarding the allegedly racist, occultist, and satanic nature of Bored Apes NFT must be commented on under oath by Wylie Oronow and Greg Solano.

It‚Äôs extra silly when you remember that this is their lawsuit. They chose to do this.

— √ò Ivan (@Ivan87403) January 9, 2023

BAYC NFT Parody Raises Many Eyebrows

Indeed, the turning point in this crypto soap opera happened when Ryder Ripps minted his own Bored Apes NFT collection just to prove a point. Later labeled a ‚Äúdemented troll‚Äù in a blog post by Yuga Labs co-founder Wylie Aronow, Mr. Ripps created satirical versions of 10,000 BAYC NFTs.

In response to the satire Bored Apes NFT collection, which quickly grossed $35 million in sales, Yuga Labs filed a lawsuit against Ryder Ripps for ‚Äòtrademark infringement.‚Äô However, much of Ryder Ripps‚Äô work revolves around the principle that ‚Äúan NFT cannot be copied.‚Äù Non-fungible tokens, by definition, cannot be replicated.

(2/2) ... us and the BAYC community, we have filed a lawsuit against the responsible parties. We will continue exploring and pursuing all legal options at our disposal.

— Yuga Labs (@yugalabs) June 25, 2022

Federal Judge Can‚Äôt Wait to Meet Bored Apes

In addition to Monday’s ruling, the Federal Judge made a couple of comments regarding the evasive tactics in the lawsuit. For instance, he says that Ripps‚Äô defendants wanted to set up depositions as soon as possible, but Yuga Labs haven‚Äôt attempted to comply.

As if that wasn‚Äôt enough, lawyer Alfred Steiner also said, ‚Äúnobody even wants to be deposed.‚Äù He was referring to the fact that the execs of Yuga Labs would be questioned about the formation of BAYC and related projects. According to the court documents, the imagery of the most successful NFT collection was built on Neo-Nazi, racist, and satanic allusions. To illustrate, the Bored Apes skull logo allegedly resembles the Nazi Totenkopf symbol.

As this question will be raised in court under penalty of perjury, the defendant is presented with a unique opportunity. He can rip into Yuga Labs and discover the true origins of the famous digital primates.

Day 537 of BAYC refusing to say who designed their Nazi logo.

Their logo is a nearly exact copy of the Waffen SS Totenkopf. Down to the number of teeth in the skull. pic.twitter.com/7gtTcgYkKt

— PAULY (@Pauly0x) October 21, 2022

On the Flipside

  • Conceptual artist Ryder Ripps is not the only one who claims that BAYC NFT artwork stems from demonic, Nazi, racist imagery.
  • Anonymous Group, the largest hacktivist group globally, also voices that opinion in a message directed to Yuga Labs.
  • Ryder Ripps has also worked closely with Kanye ‚ÄòYe‚Äô West.
  • Ye, the highly controversial music artist, was condemned by the public for anti-semitic statements, including calls for violence.
  • Before Ye‚Äôs scandal, Ryder Ripps was nicknamed Ye‚Äôs ‚ÄúDM Buddy‚Äù by Vice.

Why You Should Care

Yuga Labs is a Web3 heavyweight valued at over $4 billion. The Bored Apes Yacht Club NFT collection is also the most successful blue-chip NFT collection. It made its way to the entertainment industry, sports, and even politics.

Find out more about the latest crypto-related lawsuits:

Barry Silbert‚Äôs DCG Faces SEC and DOJ Investigation Over Internal Transfers

Three Arrows Capital Founders Ordered by Liquidators on Twitter to Provide Documents

item.title: Exclusive: Is Justin Sun’s Tron the Next FTX? USDD Back Doors Raise Concerns
item.dc:creator: David Marsanic
item.description:
A DailyCoin exclusive investigation into Tron and USDD uncovers misreported reserves, insolvency concerns, smart contract vulnerabilities, and more.

Continue reading Exclusive: Is Justin Sun’s Tron the Next FTX? USDD Back Doors Raise Concerns at DailyCoin.com.
item.content:encoded:
The collapse of Terra-Luna was one of the most disastrous events in recent crypto history. The collapse of its stablecoin, designed to be a low-volatility asset, has shaken the confidence in all stablecoins.¬†

Recent events have spotlighted the USDD token, the stablecoin created by Tron founder Justin Sun. Since early December, the token has steadily fallen below its 1:1 peg to the US dollar.¬†

USDD is currently trading in the $0.97 – $0.98 range. Following the reports of strife, layoffs, and recent outflows from his Huobi exchange, this is especially bad news for Justin Sun and Tron. However, the issues with USDD could go far deeper.

Misreported Reserves, Burn Wallets That Don‚Äôt Burn Tokens‚Ä¶

A cursory look at the USDD stablecoin and its issuer Tron DAO Reserve reveals serious issues in reserve reporting. Though the concerns will be explained in detail below, briefly, these are:¬†

  • Tron DAO Reserve claims to hold more than 200% collateral, including $725 million in one wallet. The relevant wallet address actually holds $448 million, putting the actual USDD collateralization closer to 171%.¬†
  • About half of USDD reserves are in Tron‚Äôs own TRX token. Historically, using one‚Äôs token as collateral typically does not protect investors, as with FTX and its FTT reserves.
  • Most of these reserves are in a ‚Äúburn wallet‚Äù that does not actually burn any tokens. The wallet also allows unidentified parties to withdraw tokens to different addresses.
  • Tron DAO Reserve also claims they hold significant reserves in USDC and USDT stablecoins. However, its wallet address shows that it lent all its stablecoins to Tron‚Äôs own lending platform JustLend.¬†
  • Tron DAO Reserve also advertises a 48% ‚Äúrisk-free‚Äù yearly return on investment, echoing promises made by Terra-Luna.¬†
  • A CERTIK audit found ‚Äúmajor centralization-related vulnerabilities‚Äù in JustLend‚Äôs smart contract.¬†
  • This leaves USDD with just 14,040.6 Bitcoin. BTC holdings cover just a third of all the USDD supply.¬†

Coupled with the recent crypto market downturn and rumors of Huobi‚Äôs troubles, these findings could indicate serious systemic risks in Tron‚Äôs ecosystem.

Month-Long Depegging of USDD Stablecoin

For months, USDD trended downward, struggling to maintain its peg to the dollar. On Tuesday, December 6th, things unraveled for USDD as it again fell below $0.98.¬†

source: coinmarketcap.com

This trend started as early as December 2nd, 2022, when the token skipped below $0.99. USDD continued to drop steadily in the following days, and the token has never fully recovered its $0,99 level since.¬†

However, the trend may have started earlier. According to CoinMarketCap, the last time USDD traded at $1 was on October 18th, 2022.

The consistent drops below the stablecoin peg represent a worrying signal. Investors that paid for their USDD tokens in other stablecoins want to know that they can redeem them for the same amount. They could become worried that the token will fall even further if they can’t.¬†

Not even assurances from Tron founder Justin Sun were enough to inspire confidence. Sun claimed that the token had over 200% in collateral. On-chain data shows that these figures are not accurate.¬†

USDD Missing Reserves, Inaccurate Reporting

Tron DAO Reserve and the¬†USDD website claim that every USDD token has more than twice the amount of other tokens as collateral. According to the USDD issuer, its reserves are at a 202.30% collateral ratio. On-chain data paints a different picture of USDD‚Äôs reserves.

For one, most of these reserves are in Tron‚Äôs own TRX token. Back in July, Sun claimed that USDD did not depend on the price of Tron‚Äôs token.¬†

‚ÄúThe stability of USDD is backed by the reserve assets of Tron DAO Reserve, not the price of TRX,‚Äù Sun said. ‚ÄúAs long as the TDR holds a sufficient reserve, USDD will be stable,‚Äù he added.

On-chain data shows that 48.70% of USDD reserves are in Tron‚Äôs TRX token. If TRX went down, the amount of collateralization would be impacted. Moreover, Tron DAO Reserve’s reserves are not accurately reported on its website.¬†

source: tdr.org

A section of the Tron DAO Reserve website shows that one wallet address, the ‚ÄúTRX burning contract‚Äù (more on that later), holds almost nine billion in Tron tokens (TRX), valued at $725 million.

source: tdr.org

The problem is that nine billion TRX tokens are not worth $725 million. Rather, at the current market value of $0.05 per token, the value of TRX in that wallet is closer to $498 million.

It is unclear how this discrepancy came to be. TRONSCAN, the blockchain explorer for Tron, values the tokens in the “burn wallet” correctly.

Misreporting the contents of the “burn wallet” brings the real collateralization figure down to 170.95%. Earlier, Twitter users pointed out this same discrepancy, and Tron DAO Reserve didn‚Äôt correct it.¬†

The reserves are called further into question when looking at what Tron‚Äôs ‚Äúburn wallet‚Äù actually is.¬†

Tron‚Äôs ‚ÄúBurn Wallet‚Äù Doesn‚Äôt Burn Any Tron

In most cryptocurrencies, a ‚Äúburn wallet‚Äù is a wallet address from which crypto can‚Äôt be retrieved. Projects can ‚Äúburn‚Äù their tokens to remove their supply from circulation. They can do this for several reasons, including reducing the token supply to reward investors.¬†

Burn wallets serve an important role in stablecoins. For instance, traders could burn $1 worth of Luna (LUNA) in the Terra-Luna ecosystem to get one TerraUSD (UST). The burned Luna would go to a burn wallet to remove it from circulation. At the same time, traders can burn TerraUSD to get $1 in Luna tokens. These TerraUSD tokens then go to a burn wallet, where they can‚Äôt be retrieved.¬†

USDD also has its own ‚ÄúTron multi-signature burn wallet‚Äù that performs a similar function. When users want USDD tokens, they first have to buy TRX tokens. These TRX tokens go to Tron‚Äôs burn wallet, and a user gets an equivalent amount of USDD tokens.¬†

Yet the wallet is not actually a burn wallet in the real sense of the term. In reality, the wallet‚Äôs smart contract shows that the wallet owners can retrieve the tokens and put them back into circulation. The wallet‚Äôs smart contract includes references to the redeem function.¬†

source: tronscan.org

This redeem function is behind a multi-signature key. As Tron’s website explains, multi-signature (multisig) refers to the process requiring more than one key to authorize a transaction.¬†

There is no information on who controls the signatures. That means an unknown number of users (possibly Tron insiders) can access these funds.¬†

Tron DAO Reserve advertises this “burn” contract as a part of its reserves. The $498 million in TRX in the ‚Äúburn wallet‚Äù account for 40.16% of the total reserves backing USDD.¬†

‘DeFi’ Lender JustLend Holds ALL Tron DAO Reserves‚Äô USDC and USDT Reserves

Tron DAO Reserve holds 48.70% of its reserves in Tron (TRX). According to its website, the second-largest segment of its reserves is in stablecoins.¬†

The USDD issuer says it holds many of its reserves in independent stablecoins, namely USD Coin (USDC) and Tether (USDT).

source: usdd.io

Reserves in these stablecoins account for $392,878, or about 31% of USDD reserves. However, the relevant wallet address shows that the DAO holds no USDC or USDT tokens.¬†

Instead, the wallet addresses show an equivalent amount of JustLend USDC and JustLend USDT tokens.¬†

source: tronscan.org

The issuer of these tokens is JustLend DAO, Tron‚Äôs lending platform with ties to Tron DAO Reserve.

The fact that a significant amount of USDD reserves is on JustLend could be concerning. For one, the lending platform offered yields far beyond the market rate.¬†

In May 2022, Justin Sun advertised JustLend‚Äôs 40% annual percentage yield on USDD mining. He also revealed that Tron DAO Reserve subsidizes these high yields.

Advertising a “Risk-Free” Yield of 48%

Tron DAO Reserve does the same thing. It offers “risk-free” yield farming opportunities through its stablecoins, with advertised returns as high as 48.52%.

"The TRON DAO Reserve provides risk-free yield subsidies for mainstream stablecoins on the TRON network. Supported by smart contracts on multiple platforms, it offers users higher APYs while safeguarding their assets," the website states.

source: tdr.org

The links on these claims redirect users to Tron’s SUN staking platform. There, users can stake their stablecoins to earn SUN tokens.

Instead of being “risk-free,” yield farming is a high-risk investment strategy. It exposes users to multiple risks, many of which can result in total losses. These include impairment loss, when one of the tokens of a liquidity pair falls in value. SUN’s website has a section that mentions risks. But this section is buried beep in the site‚Äôs menus, and it‚Äôs not easy to find.¬†

The inherent risks of yield-farming are not the only thing that investors should be worried about. As the FTX implosion shows, investors should consider the risk of giving custody to unregulated entities.

The Terra-Luna collapse shows there could also be a substantial counter-party risk of the entire Tron ecosystem breaking down.¬†

JustLend Smart Contract Has ‚ÄúMajor Vulnerabilities‚Äô and Centralization-Related Risks

JustLend‚Äôs security audit paints an even more concerning picture. On its website, JustLend displays a security audit by a blockchain auditing firm CertiK. In its audit, CertiK found ‚Äúmajor vulnerabilities,” including major centralization-related risks. One of these is that the smart contract has an ‚Äúadmin‚Äù role, with privileged access over all accounts.

Another part of the code gives the ‚ÄúanchorAdmin‚Äù role the ability to set anchor prices for assets and pause and resume the market.¬†

The auditing firm cautions that if the admin account were compromised, hackers could take any user’s funds on the platform. Admin privileges in the JustLend smart contract suggest that the platform is not truly trustless and decentralized.¬†

Essentially, Tron DAO Reserve is lending over $392 million in stablecoins to a centralized lending protocol that offers returns on investment far beyond the market rate.

Moreover, the ownership of this supposedly ‚Äúdecentralized‚Äù protocol is highly concentrated. The top ten token holders own 46.10% of the voting shares in the JustLend DAO.¬†

Inaccurate reporting, issues with reserves coupled with aggressive marketing yields indicate that USDD and the entire Tron ecosystem might not be as stable as Justin Sun claims.¬†

On the Flipside

  • While facts reported in this article raise concerns, they do not constitute claims that Tron or any of the related entities are actually insolvent. Investors should use their judgment when deciding where to keep their money.¬†

Why You Should Care

Tron‚Äôs ecosystem is one of the largest in the crypto space. Its TRX token is currently the 15th largest token by market capitalization, and any serious disruption could have significant ramifications for the entire crypto ecosystem.¬†

item.title: Apple to Launch Its Mixed-Reality Headset This Spring ‚Äì A Metaverse Entry?
item.dc:creator: Milko Trajcevski
item.description:
After years of development, Apple could debut in the mixed-reality space this spring with the launch of the Reality pro.

Continue reading Apple to Launch Its Mixed-Reality Headset This Spring ‚Äì A Metaverse Entry? at DailyCoin.com.
item.content:encoded:
After years of development, Apple is preparing to launch a mixed-reality headset in the spring of 2023. This will mark the tech giant‚Äôs first foray into the virtual metaverse world and compete with the likes of Meta.

The Apple Reality Pro to Debut Soon

Apple is looking to move past the recent setbacks in the mixed-reality space to launch its first mixed-reality headset this spring. The new device, which will likely be called Reality Pro, is expected to offer a mixed-reality experience ‚Äî augmented and virtual reality.¬†

The Reality Pro will feature over ten exterior and interior cameras and run on a new operating system called xrOS. Developers are already working on apps for the device, which will reportedly be released later this year.

According to reports, the Reality Pro will be a standalone headset ‚Äî not requiring a computer or phone to overlay digital imagery on top of users’ surroundings and produce immersive VR experiences.

Apple‚Äôs First Dive into the Metaverse?

Although Apple has made previous efforts into mixed, virtual, and augmented reality with the operating systems of its mobile devices, a prospective headset from Apple would mark the tech giant‚Äôs first foray into the virtual metaverse world.

The arrival of the device would create competition for Meta. It uses its own branded virtual reality headsets, Meta Quest, to access the metaverse.

On the Flipside

  • Early reports suggest that the Reality Pro could cost as much as $3,000. This is twice the price of Meta‚Äôs recent Quest Pro mixed-reality headset ($1,499).

Why You Should Care

The launch of the Apple Reality Pro could bring more competition to the mixed-reality space and hasten its development.

Find out others looking to enter the metaverse below:

Visa Files Trademarks for Metaverse and Crypto Wallets

Fidelity Plans to Launch NFT Marketplace and Offer Crypto Services in Metaverse

item.title: Gala Games Announces GALA to Power Town Star in New Ecosystem Update
item.dc:creator: Insha Zia
item.description:
The CEO believes this is the best decision, considering that Mark Skaggs, ex-lead developer for Farmville, is taking charge.

Continue reading Gala Games Announces GALA to Power Town Star in New Ecosystem Update at DailyCoin.com.
item.content:encoded:
• Gala Games has announced that GALA will replace TOWN in the flagship farming game Town Star¬†in the latest ecosystem update.¬†
  • Eric ‚ÄòBenefactor‚Äô Schiermeyer, Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer of Gala Games, has shared on the official Discord channel that Gala Games will replace all TOWN with GALA, swapping at a two-to-one ratio.¬†

The decision is part of Gala Games‚Äô strategy to improve Town Star and make it more aligned with the Gala Games ecosystem. Benefactor has revealed that they have been testing different types of tokenomics for over a year. The CEO believes this is the best decision, especially considering that Mark Skaggs, ex-lead developer for Farmville, is taking charge.

Benefactor announces that $GALA will be the token that powers @TownStarGame and will swap all $TOWN for $GALA at a 2:1 ratio. Check out the announcement in our Discord at https://t.co/qSszqareBK! pic.twitter.com/bRMyePY5zP

— Gala Games (@GoGalaGames) January 9, 2023

Bringing in the Big Guns

In a detailed update on the official Discord channel, Gala Games‚Äô CEO shared that their flagship Web3 farming game, Town Star, has been through several changes, especially with improvements to play-to-earn mechanics.¬†

Gala Games’ CEO added that the onboarding of Mark Skaggs to lead Town Star was one of the most significant changes they‚Äôve made. Skaggs is most notable for his efforts in leading Farmville, one of the most influential farming simulators and social media games. He played a significant role in maintaining Farmville‚Äôs 80 million user base and is now responsible for growing Town Star.¬†

Eric ‚ÄòBenefactor‚Äô Schiermeyer, Co-founder and Chief Executive Officer of Gala Games, shared:¬†

‚ÄúI recall a conversation with Mark Zuckerberg in which he said people were coming to Facebook just to play Farmville to the tune of 100s of millions. In many ways, Facebook wouldn't be the behemoth it is today if not for Mark Skaggs and Farmville. I've asked him to do it again. Who knows if we can actually get there, but if there was going to be a team to attempt it, this is the team.‚Äù

To grow Town Star into a massive game, Schiermeyer asserted that they must constantly make changes to improve the game, announcing the end of TOWN.¬†

He later announced that Town Star nodes would begin to earn GALA through a burn mechanism similar to Spider Tanks. When users purchase certain items in the Town Star game with GALA, the mechanism will burn the GALA and remint a portion of the burned tokens to the nodes and the play-and-earn pool.¬†

The CEO added that Gala Games would release a lite paper soon discussing the Town Star‚Äôs new play-to-earn mechanisms, tokenomics, and other important details.¬†

The TOWN to Gala exchange is expected to happen sometime in the next 60 days, and users will have at least 180 days to make the exchange.¬†

At the end of the announcement, Gala Games shared that there will be a playtest at the end of this month, and users can expect a full release in February. The new version will host the new earning feature and other features such as decorations, leveling up NFTs, and more.

On the Flipside

  • Gala Games had previously halted Town Star Rewards due to the lack of users running Town Star nodes.
  • Town Star reportedly burned 97.5% of its unused NFTs in a virtual bonfire in Q4 2022.¬†
  • Each Gala Founder Node costs $95,000 to $100,000, while a Town Star Node ranges from $12,000 to $15,000.

Why You Should Care

Since Gala Games had paused the game‚Äôs reward distribution mechanism, Town Stars did not incentivize users to play the farm-building game. However, in the latest ecosystem update, Gala Games aims to reignite users‚Äô interest by restarting the reward mechanism and significantly improving the game.¬†


You may also like:

Town Star Adds Visa and Mastercard as Payment Options for NFTs in Gala Games Store

item.title: Binance Outflows Sees the Exchange Lose 25% of Its Assets in Under Two Months
item.dc:creator: Milko Trajcevski
item.description:
The cash outflow from Binance is worse than CZ indicated, with exchange losing 25% of its assets in two months.

Continue reading Binance Outflows Sees the Exchange Lose 25% of Its Assets in Under Two Months at DailyCoin.com.
item.content:encoded:
Binance, the world‚Äôs largest cryptocurrency exchange, is going through a rough patch, losing almost 25% of its assets in less than 60 days as CEO Changpeng ‚ÄòCZ‚Äô Zhao runs the exchange without a chief financial officer.

Binance Loses 25% of Its Assets

In mid-December, CZ reported that Binance had recorded over $3 billion in outflows but assured users that the exchange would survive any crypto winter. However, the outflow of cash from Binance is significantly worse than CZ indicated.

According to a recent analysis of the exchange, Binance has recorded over $12 billion in asset outflows in the last two months, with $360 million coming last Friday. The BNB coin has also lost 30% of its value within that time, leaving Binance with only 29 billion of the coin.

On December 14th, the amount of Binance USD (BUSD) held by the exchange fell by $3.5 billion as users swapped the stablecoin for USDC and USDT. The number of BUSD stablecoins held by Binance has fallen by 40%, amounting to a 25% loss in all assets.

Why is Binance Losing Assets?

The performances of BNB and BUSD reflect the growing lack of investors‚Äô trust in the exchange. The exchange‚Äôs asset holdings fell by 15% in a single day as CZ downplayed the Nansen report withdrawals in mid-December.

Binance also allegedly sent $232 million in BUSD to Binance.US. However, the move has sparked questions about CZ‚Äôs capability to manage the exchange, which has been without a Chief Financial Official (CFO) since the departure of Zhou Wei in June 2021.

On the Flipside

  • Binance‚Äôs co-founder He Yi has said that no employee of the company is allowed to conduct personal short-term crypto transactions and must hold the position for more than 90 days before trading.

Why You Should Care

Binance has not emerged unscathed by the nearly yearlong crypto decline, worsened by several top companies’ collapse.

Read about CZ‚Äôs reaction to outflows in:
Binance Outflows Tops $3 Billion, CZ Says the Exchange Will Survive Any Crypto Winter

The exchange‚Äôs recent expansion moves are covered below:
Binance Moves to Acquire South Korean Crypto Exchange GOPAX: Sources
